availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah John Martin (Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Edmund Martin. Married to Nancy Jane McCormick Martin in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in January 1843. Father to John L. Martin, Sarah J. Martin, and Edmond Martin. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 401B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 5.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 861.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252404, p. 418.
